intro: Peutalis incana, commonly known as the silverleaf peat moss, is a member of the family Sphagnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, spongy growth form and silvery-gray coloration due to the presence of specialized structures called hyaline cells. This plant thrives in acidic, nutrient-poor environments such as peat bogs and wetlands. Its ability to retain water makes it an important component of wetland ecosystems. Peutalis incana plays a crucial role in carbon sequestration and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
